channel.title: dsudo - default password sudo
channel.description:
Instead of using
sudo
use
dsudo
As long as still using the [default password](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Default_Passwords) (not having changed sudo password), sudo can be run without entering a password. This is useful for users having issues with their [keyboard layout](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Keyboard_Layout) and for testing VMs.
Available in all repositories and installed by default already.
References:
* https://github.com/Whonix/anon-base-files/blob/master/man/dsudo.8.ronn * https://github.com/Whonix/anon-base-files/blob/master/usr/bin/dsudo * https://github.com/Whonix/anon-base-files/blob/master/usr/lib/derivative-base-files/askpass-default

item.title: dsudo - default password sudo

item.title: dsudo - default password sudo
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Instead of using

sudo

use

dsudo

As long as still using the default password (not having changed sudo password), sudo can be run without entering a password. This is useful for users having issues with their keyboard layout and for testing VMs.

Available in all repositories and installed by default already.

References:

  • https://github.com/Whonix/anon-base-files/blob/master/man/dsudo.8.ronn
  • https://github.com/Whonix/anon-base-files/blob/master/usr/bin/dsudo
